Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Best Buy and had almost the exact same experience as a previous reviewer.  After about 40 days (10 days after the return period), it stopped responding to the remote and the picture began turning blank more and more frequently until eventually it just stayed blank.  Dealing with Westinghouse is a nightmare.  It took me several weeks of trying before I was able to speak with anyone.  The only responses to my e-mails were auto generated and told me to call the same number that was in the product guide. After paying $80 to have it shipped, it shipped back about two weeks later and it was immediately clear it had not been repaired.  When I called Westinghouse, after being on hold for 20 minutes the representative I spoke to could not have been ruder,  I honestly think there is a warrantee process designed to give customers the run around until they give up.  Maybe the worst purchase I've ever made.

Reviews.Title: More than just a bad batch, a bad TV in-general. Don't be tempted by price, because this is garbage.
Reviews.Author: Level99
Reviews.Content: Well, it's nice to know I'm not the only one who purchased this from Best Buy and am experiencing the exact same issues.I bought this from Best Buy #1436 on 10/12/11 as I was building an entertainment setup for numerous old and new video game systems.  I rarely used it but for the first three months it suited my needs.  The sound is absolutely horrible on the built-in speakers, but the headphone-out jack facilitated enough for an external sound system to compensate.  The video quality was slightly below average, but that was to be expected.Then, almost EXACTLY after the 33rd day, I started experiencing some strange picture issues.  For the first week, I got about an hour of use before the picture started going out.  And when I say it started going out, I'm not referring to the inputs not being detected properly.  The audio and video connections were solid, and no matter what kind of input I tried, the picture would still flicker in and out.  Specifically, the picture would start to crush upwards with various scattered green lines.  Spastic flickering accompanied this until the picture just completely cut out, and the audio would still be running.  Sometimes, just waiting would bring the video back temporarily, and then it would go out again in the same way.  Sometimes the video would not come back at all.Here's the kicker: the GUI boxes and menu were succumbing to those symptoms as well, so it was the entire display hardware that was glitching and failing, not the inputs.Restarting it temporarily fixed it at first, but as time went by, the symptoms increased and power cycling no longer remedied it.  You know what started helping temporarily fixing it? Read this slowly: a somewhat forceful jab down on the top of the tv.  YEAH, just like an old CRT getting bad UHF reception, banging on the top of the set helped for a little bit.  I have never in my life seen a digital TV be remedied by physical force that way.  I can only assume that there might be some loose solder on one or more of the internal connections.  I'd attempt to open it and check myself if I weren't afraid it were going to electrically shock me, which considering the possible culprits for this kind of issue, is probable.As of today, the picture doesn't show up at all anymore.  I hadn't used it in about 3 weeks but in that time it apparently decided to just stop working entirely picture-wise.  I haven't tried calling about the warranty yet, however having read what other people have experienced, if Westinghouse tells me to pay for the shipping to have it "repaired", I will tell them that I'll spend the money on a sledge instead to get a few last fleeting moments of enjoyment out of the box, and vow to never buy a Westinghouse product ever again.Take it from me: avoid this set for any cost.  In fact, avoid it even if you get it for free.  You'll end up with a very large impractical paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Device Input Malfunction
Reviews.Author: E. Martinez
Reviews.Content: We have the exact same problem. We bought this TV at Best Buy, but I was past their (absurd) 30 day return policy by a week. The TV keeps losing signal regardless of multiple attempts with cables and devices.Here are the devices I tried on this tv:Xbox 360 with HDMI, Samsung Blu Ray with a different HDMI, DVD Player with Component, Old Xbox with RCA's.Plugged the same devices with same cables to a Vizio and each one worked.Please if you experience this issue with this TV, let us know. Specially if you purchased it from Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: How to FIX your Westinghouse Best Buy 32" LED TV
Reviews.Author: Aron Hsiao
Reviews.Content: Like others that have written reviews here, I bought this at Best Buy just over a year ago.Like others that have written reviews here, this thing started to have intermittent display issues.Unlike the average customer, I'm pretty handy with electronics (I was once a computer engineering student and computer hardware designer) so I popped this thing open, knowing that the kinds of issues I was seeing just screamed "cold solder joint!"A cold solder joint is an electrical connection that was improperly made, and that has cracked or shifted as a result, leading to no connection where there was once a connection.The problem was obvious once the set was open. I don't think there is a single good solder joint here. I have no idea who did the assembly for Westinghouse for this device, but they likely had faulty equipment, judging by what I saw.Happily, if you have a soldering iron, or are willing to go to Radio Shock and invest in a $15 soldering iron and $4 worth of rosin core electronics solder, you can fix this yourself, if you're reasonably mechanically inclined. Here's how:1) Remove all the screws on the back panel, including the screws holding the two small panels on the back of the set closed. Don't miss the four screws holding the stand in place, or the single screw behind the stand once you remove it.2) When you remove the two small panels on the back of the set, disconnect the wires behind them (you'll have to remove some electrical tape to see them). The smaller panel has two small ribbon cables under it, each with a tiny plastic connector. Stick your fingernail under the side of the connector where the wires enter it in each case and pry a little. The connector will "pop open" like a door swinging on a hinge, and the ribbon cables will slide easily out. The larger panel has one multi-wire connector. Squeeze it on both ends (there are two tiny metal levers, one on each end--squeeze them) and it will also slide out easily.3) Lay the set down on a soft, flat surface, face (screen) down and remove the entire (large) back cover. This will take patience. There are small plastic clips around the sides that you can't see and that hold it in place; you don't want to break these. It will seem impossible to open at first. Start at the bottom of the set (where the stand attaches) and gently pry open JUST A LITTLE. Then, press inward around the edges (press on the protruding outer edges, toward the center of the TV) and at the same time gently lift on the rear panel just over the place where you're pressing. Work at it for a while. Patience and hand sensitivity is key. You'll get a sense for how it's clipped eventually, and you'll get it off. DO NOT USE FORCE TO PRY THE SET OPEN since this will flex the LED panel and destroy the TV. Patience. You'll get it.4) Once open, DO NOT PULL UP RAPIDLY ON THE BACK COVER. There is one more small wire connector that runs from the front half to the back half of the TV, and that attaches to the red power light and the remote sensor via a small white connector. Wriggle the small white connector until it pops out. Don't pull on the wires; they're very thin single-conductor wires and will break with force. Pull on the connector ONLY as you wiggle it back and forth. Patience is important here, too.5) The set is now open and you'll see the backs of two circuit boards, one for power, one for imaging. You'll also see a bunch of little stiff wires poking up through it, each one with a tiny blob of metal holding it in place. Some of them will be in rows. These are the problem points. They SHOULD be shiny and smooth. Instead, you'll note that they are grey, dirty-looking, and show cracks under a magnifying glass. You're going to "reflow" all of these.6) Plug in your soldering iron, let it heat up, coat the tip with the solder you bought, and then, gradually, re-melt all of the little metal blob areas holding wires in place. You may have to hold the soldering iron against each poking-out wire for several seconds to get it to re-melt, and you may have to add a small amount of solder in some cases to get the result to be shiny and smooth. BE CAREFUL NOT TO "CONNECT" any of these little blobs or wires together with extra melted metal; none were touching each other when you began, and none should be touching each other once you're done.7) After you've re-melted each little solder joint that you see (do ONLY the ones with wires poking up through them, avoid touching any other areas of solder), reverse the disassembly process carefully to reassemble your TV.If you want the best chance of pulling this off, watch a "how to solder" video or two on YouTube to get a feel for what you're aiming for as you fix the numerous cold solder joints inside this set.Once you're done, if you're just a bit lucky, the set will power on and operate as usual, and will no longer suffer from the problems you've been experiencing.Based on the reviews here, it's clear that this particular model went through a completely botched assembly process, which is a shame and a waste of good components and materials (considering how many of these likely ended up in the dumpster). Hopefully Westinghouse has ended its relationship with said assembler, who produced some of the worst solder joints I've seen over the decades I've worked with electronics, something rare for mass production goods (I suspect that there was a faulty equipment issue at this assembler).Because for all intents and purposes this is a defective product as it ships new, and will require repair if it is to continue working for very long, I have to give this set just one star. On the other hand, if you're able to fix this yourself by reflowing the 20-30 solder joints inside (it took me about 45 minutes to get this done, from beginning to end, and I just reflowed all of them because they all looked horrible to me), it's a reasonable set that should then serve you for some time to come.But I doubt I'll buy Westinghouse again--because I don't know whether they're still using that same assembly plant/contractor, and even with the fix made it's 45 minutes of my life I'll never have back, which (at my hourly rate) raises the cost of the set considerably.

Reviews.Title: Good LED Lcd for the price
Reviews.Author: sparta man
Reviews.Content: After a week of buying it from BB and having this in the bedroom, I have to say this is a good buy. I am running Netflix(at HD, I might add) and blurays from my player to this TV and it produces a great clear picture.I run the regular broadcast thru a coax cable so the picture is what it is. I am no audiophile so the sound seems fine to me. I have the volume up about 1/8 and the mrs complain its too loud downstairs. Go figure.  Besides, its hard to crank up the volume with kids sleeping a few feet away.I hear there are problems with this brand so I purchased a warranty to be on the safe side.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Raymond Waff
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV at Best Buy. Had it for Only 45 days before it started cutting in and out (giving error message that reads no signal) Tried to exchange it at Best Buy for same model, but because It was past 30 days they said I would have to deal with the manufacturer for the warrantee. Had to send to Texas to be repaired, shipping and materials to ship cost $80.00. Don't buy this TV Spend A little more money for a better brand. Cause if you do buy this TV you wind up spending the money anyway to send it to be repaired.

Reviews.Title: good picture but it certainly has a defect
Reviews.Author: 19can84
Reviews.Content: Picture and sound quality is good but after 3 mounts of rare usage picture start to disappear.You have to ship it to Houston TX at your own cost which is almost half of the products price to get service.It is clear that their policy is selling defect product at low price and pushing the customer into a dilemma between cost of shipping and the TV. I think it is a fraud.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE WESTINGHOUSE TV LD 3235
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM B. LEWIS
Reviews.Content: The worst TV I have ever seen or used.  After a few months of use signal problems developed.  I did everything to fix the problem and even had the cable company come out and change all my boxes.  The same problem, lines, colors, picture goes blank.  I move the HDMI input cables slightly and the TV has a picture for another 3 minutes before going bad again.  Picture goes in and out.  I think NOTHING less than a class action lawsuit will motivate this company into doing their job.

Reviews.Title: Same story as the rest
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Westinghouse TV.  The first has worked well for many years, so I decided to buy a new one.  I have had this one for about 6 months and the great picture went out.  I went to Best Buy, where I purchased it, and they told me that they don't deal with manufacturers warranties.  They only help out when you purchse their extended warranty.  I have contacted westinghouse by email, and I am hoping for a better experience than everyone else had.  Bottom line...do not buy this product!  Unless Westinghouse does a recall, or something, I won't be buying any more products from them.

Reviews.Title: Terrible sound and died completely after eight months
Reviews.Author: BJRMBA1
Reviews.Content: Terrible sound and died completely after eight months.  We bought this at Best Buy last summer because it appeared to be a great deal.  The sound sucked but we fixed that with some cheap computer speakers and moved on.  Eight months later it was dead!!!

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: W. STEVENS
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son for his birthday 6 months ago. he told me last month that the TV had been losing the picture every once in a while for a few months before that. I figured it was a problem with the connection and got a new cable. I was wrong and the other day it just stopped working. Same as everyone else, I was told by Best Buy that they won't do anything since I didn't buy their warranty. There is no way I'm paying to ship this piece of junk to Texas to fix, so I guess it will go in the trash. I would never buy another product from Westinghouse again, and I don't think I'll be going back to Best Buy either as the woman has an attitude because I didn't buy their extra warranty. Sorry but I should expect a TV to last at least a few years. Hell, I still have an old tube one that's got to be 10 years old. This is the worst TV ever made. Please do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Horrible quality!
Reviews.Author: Joe Pace
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv thinking I would give the unknown brand a try.  After all, I got it on a deal quite cheap.  Clearly, you get what you pay for.  It has been a nightmare to have this TV.  With not even a month of use, the screen flickers and goes blank.  Now the tv is useless as you never know if it'll have an image the next time you turn it on. I would have returned the tv, but I couldn't since I am not from the US and I took the tv with me to my home country.  Hence, I've taken it 3 times to get it fixed, and the repairman acknowledges its poor quality and make.  I would never buy a Westinghouse item again.

Reviews.Title: same tv problems as others, do not waste your money!!!!!
Reviews.Author: clm
Reviews.Content: Bought this Tv 11/26/2011 from HHGregg, a week ago it started getting lines and black screen, had good sound if I wanted to listen to my show as I could not watch it!! After a week the issue keeps getting worse and lasting longer times took 15 minutes last night to get the picture to come on just had the black screen or fuzzy lines. I am not going to wait for no picture at all. Called HHG and they are going to let me exchange it but I am getting a different brand this time. Please head the reviews this is a common problem with this Westinghouse TV. They should be ashamed of the quality of their product. Don't just walk away run as fast as you can. Complete waste of money....................

Reviews.Title: TV failed-  - I would give it zero stars if I could
Reviews.Author: Chicago
Reviews.Content: Got the TV at Best Buy in August on sale.  It worked well for about two months, then the problems started.First, on a sporadic basis, the picture would suddenly go blank.  If the TV was left on long enough, it would come back in about ten or fifteen minutes.  Then, after another hour or so, it would go blank again.I called customer support in about November shortly after the problem started happening.  They instructed me to reset the TV to factory settings.  Well, the problem went away for a while, but the picture was just a small square in the middle of the 32" screen.  Call me crazy, but when I buy a 32" TV, I don't think its unreasonable to expect the full screen to be used.  I seemed to get a special Westinghouse feature - picture within no picture!  Regardless, I didn't follow up with customer service because at least it had a picture.Then, about a month ago, the picture again started going blank.  Resetting to factory settings didn't help, and it recently started happening every time we turned on the set.Last night was the end.  The TV would not power up at all.I called customer service today, and was told the TV was still under warranty (yes!).  However, I would have to pay to ship the TV to Houston TX to get it fixed.  The rep told me after putting me on hold that they could not waive the shipping charges, it was their policy.  They would not send a technician to my house, either.So, basically I was sold a defective TV, and now have to pay about $90 to pack and ship it to Houston because of its poor workmanship.  That's not going to happen.  Instead, I will chuck the thing into the garbage, and never, ever, ever, ever buy a Westinghouse product again.The sad thing is that Westinghouse made plenty of money selling me junk.  My cost to get it fixed is too high, so I'm off to buy another TV.  Meanwhile, Westinghouse gets to keep all of their money off of my sale.  They do need to own up to their problem, but refuse to do it.  Well, only at further expense to me, the consumer.Judging by the other reviews of this product, my experience is not unique.  Westinghouse should recall the product or issue refunds.

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse 32inch LED-  Love it!
Reviews.Author: Scott A. Marchiny
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv about 4 days ago and cant say one bad thing about it so far.  Right out of the box the picture is amazing.  No need to tweek the settings or anything.  Some were complaining that the speakers were too weak but Westinghouse mustve fixed the problem because it gets plenty loud!  Wish the remote was backlit but what do you want for under 300 bucks?  Great led tv at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Waste of time
Reviews.Author: Ryan Blackwell
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV from Target a couple weeks ago for our bedroom.  When we unpackaged it we noticed that Westinghouse apparently decided to put the yellow sticker describing the energy usage on the actual screen of the television, instead of on the protective plastic that the television comes with.  Once we removed the sticker and set the tv up, the entire bottom right corner of the screen was noticeably discolored in the shape of the sticker.  It never went away.  I don't know how Westinghouse could be so stupid as to package it with a sticker directly on the LED screen, but I returned it to Target and exchanged it for a 32" Vizio which is awesome.

Reviews.Title: this is the worse customer service ever
Reviews.Author: D. Thornberry
Reviews.Content: 10 months old and started flickering!The hassle of the warranty. My wife called them and they wanted to give her a whole lot of trouble and excuses.I live in Houston where there is a service center and they wanted her to send it to California said it was out of warranty!I will not buy this brand again even!Now maybe you can try this it worked for me.If you look on the back at the top there is a little door with 2 screws securing it. Remove it there is a small white flat ribbon cable unplug it and and plug it back in. The fine little contacts corrode and by doing this you are removing the the fine corrosion on the plug just like cleaning a battery to make better contact. This saved me  the hassle of the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Stacey Hanrahan "aa7ya"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV from Best Buy also.  Have had it installed for 3 weeks now.  Previous TV was a LCD from Samsung that I had for about 3 years, and this particular TV is a replacement for that Samsung.  At the time I bought it from BB, they were having a two day sale on all TV in stock, so I got this particular TV at a much reduced price.  Since I have a small apartment and a small living room, this 32 inch TV is the perfect size for my small apartment living space.  I would give this TV a five, but the reason I am giving this a four star rating is because when you switch between SD and HD channels, the TV gives you a message saying "Detecting Signal" for about 10 seconds before the picture come up.  The Samsung I had before this one, didn't have that problem going from a 480i SD signal to a 1080i HD signal.  This is my only complaint about this model.  Other than that, it has wonderful picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: defective TV
Reviews.Author: jean b cervantes
Reviews.Content: Add one more television to this list...purchased new from Tigerdirect in December 2012 and less than one year later the picture starting blacking out. I tried moving from one bedroom to another and the problem has persisted. Seems like Westinghouse would have the good sense to recall this model because 'word of mouth' negative reviews can be a killer.This is the last Westinghouse product we will purchase.

Reviews.Title: A temporary fix
Reviews.Author: Jenny Steeves
Reviews.Content: TV worked fine when we first got it, but then the screen would flicker and over time it got worse and worse, until it didn't work any more. I'm an engineer, but not an electrical engineer and often get frustrated with electronic things.  In my industry we find percussive maintenance can solve a lot of issues, so I took to banging on the TV (what harm could I do, it was already not working).  But I discovered that this actually would fix it!  Eventually I got it down to if I pressed on the upper part of the TV, it would get better momentarily.  I assumed that there must be some loose connection causing the issues so when even this no longer worked, I pulled the whole thing off the wall and decided to take it apart.  But I couldn't figure out how to get the back off (see another reviewers detailed instructions).  So I just stuck my fingers in the openings from the small panels and wiggled the wires, put it back together and amazingly the thing worked like new again!  However, in a few months the problem will start over, getting worse and worse until I wiggle those connections again.  I've been doing this for a couple of years now and it's still going.  It only takes a few minutes...But, this TV sucks!

Reviews.Title: Unhappy Customer
Reviews.Author: M. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I should have listened, I bought this TV with the hopes of getting a random quality product.  Noooooo!!!!!  Less than 6 months (better than some others) I too get the blank black screen of death.  Of course I'm checking all my inputs (can't be the HDTV?) who was I kidding!  I am so mad at myself for buying and Westinghouse for putting out such an inferior product.  I will not spend or send anymore money for anything Westinghouse again.  "BUYER BEWARE"  READ! all the reviews below and the Best Buy customer sites.  As for Best Buy (where I purchased this junk) they should be ashamed for carrying such substandard products in there stores.  I will make my case with them (i am sure without any resolution)  But, never the less, I will ensure Westinghouse hears me and Best Buy will understand my grief over this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy any Westinglhouse TV especially the LD-3235
Reviews.Author: angrywestinghousebuyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased three LD-3235 LED TV's for my beach vacation rental in October 2011. It is January 2013 and I was informed by tenants that two of the TV's have blank screens. They have had some flicker problems off and on in the past but seem to work for most the tenants. Now they are both blank screen with sound most of the time. If I move the TV or lightly tap it they will both get a picture but quickly go blank again with some line waves then blank. Because it is two of the three TV's with exactly the same problem it is obviously a manufacturuer defect. I called Best Buy and was referred to Westinghouse. I am waiting on a response but I do not have any hope of saving my $600 investment based on what I see from other people's experience. I wanted to get something on this site to warn people not to buy this product. It is really a piece of junk. I should have gotten more than 15 months use out of it. I will never buy Westinghouse again.

Reviews.Title: everyone has had some horrible luck
Reviews.Author: deadpool
Reviews.Content: i bought one of these 2 years ago from costco and its still going strong, the hd is great specially for my 360 games, for the value its definitely worth it

Reviews.Title: Has been working fine for me
Reviews.Author: JASON LAWRENCE
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon.  I don't think they offer it anymore.  I actually have it outside in my patio.  During the summer, I use it almost everyday.  It's already gone through it's 2nd summer.  I have it hooked up to a terrestrial antenna and blu ray player and the picture is decent for being outside on bright sunny day.  Really the only complaint I have is that the tuner is really slow.  Other than that; for the price ($199 on sale), it's been a great tv.

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse does not stand by product.
Reviews.Author: scoob
Reviews.Content: Bought a tv on Black Friday from Westinghouse. TV defective. Westinghouse will not stand by warranty. Product is subpar. Customer service ineffective.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL
Reviews.Author: Ricky T
Reviews.Content: I am shipping mine back for the third time now. This tv is the worst product I have ever purchased. I was supposed to be shipped a new tv by Westinghouse but received the same one, that was supposed to have been repaired. When I received it back for the second time, it would not pick up any digital stations. I would not buy this model. Westinghouse is now sending me a 39" tv for all of my inconveniece and I hope I'm not shipping the 39" back also. If you do purchase the LD-3235, make sure you save your box and packing for when you have to ship it back as the first time it cost me $80.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this crap TV!!
Reviews.Author: Big Texas
Reviews.Content: If you are looking at these reviews and think you want to own this TV, put your credit card back in your wallet. This TV is a pile of junk, if you don't believe me read the other twenty people who had the exact same issues I have.  I bought this TV as a gift, it lasted 3 weeks before the picture stopped working. I had it shipped back to Texas at some ridiculous cost to me, what a huge waste of time and money. The company has clearly had issues with this TV and instead of maybe recalling it, they just keep stocking this pig in Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable, poor support - just don't bother
Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: WHEN WORKING - this is not a bad TV.  It can be a bit slow when switching inputs, but certainly acceptable picture and sound (granted, we got this to replace a 20 inch TV/VCR combo purchased in 1996, but...)Unfortunately, as did many others, we started having a problem with the picture being covered by horizontal lines about 3 months after purchasing the set.  The service rep at Westinghouse pointed out that when she buys a product, she researches it on the internet, and if I had done so, she and I would not be having the conversation.  (The only way I can interpret this is that they know it's a glitchy TV, and won't buy it themselves)The good news (as of June 2012) - when we called Westinghouse, they eventually sent us a prepaid Fed Ex shipping label.The bad news1) Had to ship from Honolulu to Texas.2) Fed Ex will not pack a TV this size, so you have to pack something that the shipping experts won't.3) U-Haul has a ninety dollar box this size, designed for TVs.  I found a twenty dollar box at the UPS store, and a couple rolls of bubble wrap at Walmart, before taking this to Fed Ex4) It took 21 days to ship, repair, and return it5) Their packaging consisted of 4 folded pieces of foam and a plastic bag - much more poorly packed than mine6) The screws to hold the TV to the base were not returned, so I'm still waiting on getting replacement screws sent from Westinghouse before I can reassemble and test the TV (I could probably measure the holes and find replacements at the hardware store, but this is Westinghouse's mistake - I have photos to show I sent them the screws, so they can fix it).So, if you want to deal with snarky customer service, drive to multiple places to deal with the shipping, and have no TV for close to a month, go ahead and order this (actually, we hooked up the 1996 TV - that at least still works).  If it works when they send me the rest of the parts, great.  If not, I give up and will get a new one.  In either case, this company has lost our business for good.

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: KjFlyer
Reviews.Content: Where to start on this gem of electronic mediocrity. I received this gift for Christmas (2011). Setup was easy and the picture was very good for the first 4 months. Then subtle lines started to develop on the screen running horizontally. First I thought it was video game that was glitching out. Nope not so lucky. Within a week these lines would morph into solid bands and then the screen would completely black out after 5-10 minutes rendering it a big flat sound box (not even a radio. After speaking to customer service and sending them arbitrary photos of the TV I sent it down to Texas. To their credit they sent it back very quickly but only to find that they failed to package the screws allowing for the base of the TV to be attached to the stand. Also the bezel was chipped and broken running along the bottom of the screen. I can tell you without a doubt my packaging job exceeded how they returned to the TV to me. The best part is I opened a case file with them in May and I paid for shipping from Ohio to Texas which makes zero sense. Your product broke with months of purchase and I have to fork over money to send it in for repair. Wonderful business model.I then call to have screws and a new bezel shipped to me along with a demand for reimbursement for shipping cost. I am told that Westinghouse now offers pre-payed shipping labels starting June of 2012 but since I opened a file in May 2012 I could not be reimbursed. How is that my problem? What a joke.Westinghouse used to be a respectable brand but they are bottom of the barrel now. Stick with the big dogs Samsung, Sony, LG etc.I just hope this thing lasts a few years and then I will never buy Westinghouse again. Stay far and away from this company. If you made the mistake of buying this or similar models hold onto the box! It makes a great shipping package for the inevitable repair trip these junk products will make.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS!
Reviews.Author: Mary C. Ruiz
Reviews.Content: TV worked for about 2 months and then the screen started to flicker until eventually it stopped working altogether. I guess you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: Shippement damage
Reviews.Author: D Means
Reviews.Content: I was not happy my grandmother TV was damaged unpon arrival.... The return service was good, but I had to go buy one loclly for my grandmother for the christmas gift...

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY
Reviews.Author: Jeff Burgess
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for 6 months and it just stopped working.  Very disappointing. I'll try going to the manufacture and will report back.This review in now way should reflect on Amazon.  Over the years I've had very good luck purchasing items their site.  I won't be buying TV's on Amazon any more though.

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse Bomb LD-3235 TV and a Best Buy Betrayal
Reviews.Author: MKR
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Best Buy in August 2011. In the spring of 2012 my daughter was telling me about how it would get jumpy and then go black. I checked all the connections and I turned it on and it stayed on, I figured something was loose. My daughter kept telling me that it would go black after a while watching it. Now it only plays the sound and no picture. You would think that there would be a recall on this, but I have not seen one. I did not expect to have only six months of usage from a product. Westinghouse should be ashamed of themselves, a once highly regarded product name now a piece of manure. Best Buy should be ashamed of themselves for hearing of this problem and not taking a stand for their customers. I guess you should buy the insurance when purchasing from Best Buy, they know something we don't. I know something now, I will never purchase a Westinghouse product and I will not shop at Best Buy.

Reviews.Title: NOT WORTH IT
Reviews.Author: Paul M.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom. I put it up and the picture and sound were very good. Two days after starting to use this TV, the picture went blank. I do have sound but no picture. At first if I turned it off, the picture would come on for a few minutes and then go blank. Now it is blank all the time. I am packageing the unit up and going to return it for another brand. Do not waste your money!

Reviews.Title: Never buy Westinghouse
Reviews.Author: jderouse
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for Christmas from another online store.  Lasted 6 weeks before picture went out.  I get the same from the Westinghouse customer service as everyone else here. I have to pay to ship it to Texas.  So what I thought was a good deal on the TV now isn't.  I should have bought a more reputable brand to begin with.  I will never buy another Westinghouse anything.

ProductInfo.Features:
2 HDMI inputs(HDMI cable not included) - High-speed HDMI cable is the only connection that can deliver a full HDTV experience with a full 720p picture and digital surround sound
176 degree horizontal and vertical viewing angles - Enable easy viewing from multiple vantage points
31.5" screen measured diagonally from corner to corner for optimal viewing in medium-size rooms
Ultraslim design (2-3/8" deep), ideal for wall mounting (with optional mounting kit, not included)
100,000:1 dynamic contrast ratio (3000:1 native) delivers bright whites and deep blacks for enhanced image color and vibrancy
ProductInfo.Name: Westinghouse LD-3235 32-Inch 720p LED HDTV (Black)
